001package edu.pdx.cs410J.whitlock;
002
003import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
004
005import java.util.List;
006
007import static java.util.Collections.emptyList;
008import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
009import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.containsString;
010import static org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual.equalTo;
011
012/**
013 * Unit tests for the Student class.  In addition to the JUnit annotations,
014 * they also make use of the <a href="http://hamcrest.org/JavaHamcrest/">hamcrest</a>
015 * matchers for more readable assertion statements.
016 */
017public class StudentTest
018{
019
020  @Test
021  void studentNamedPatIsNamedPat() {
022    String name = "Pat";
023    var pat = new Student(name, emptyList(), 0.0, Gender.OTHER);
024    assertThat(pat.getName(), equalTo(name));
025  }
026
027  private Student getDave() {
028    List<String> classes = List.of("Algorithms", "Operating Systems", "Java");
029
030    return new Student("Dave", classes, 3.64, Gender.MALE);
031  }
032
033  @Test
034  void daveStudentFromAssignment() {
035    Student dave = getDave();
036
037    assertThat(dave.toString(), equalTo("Dave has a GPA of 3.64 and is taking 3 classes: Algorithms, Operating " +
038      "Systems, and Java.  He says \"This class is too much work\"."));
039  }
040
041  @Test
042  void toStringContainsStudentName() {
043    Student dave = getDave();
044
045    assertThat(dave.toString(), containsString("Dave"));
046  }
047
048  @Test
049  void toStringContainsGpa() {
050    double gpa = 3.45;
051    Student student = new Student("Name", emptyList(), gpa, Gender.OTHER);
052
053    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(String.valueOf(gpa)));
054  }
055
056  @Test
057  void toStringContainsNameAndGpa() {
058    double gpa = 3.45;
059    String name = "Name";
060    Student student = new Student(name, emptyList(), gpa, Gender.OTHER);
061
062    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(name + " has a GPA of " + gpa));
063
064  }
065
066  @Test
067  void studentTakingZeroClasses() {
068    double gpa = 3.45;
069    String name = "Name";
070    Student student = new Student(name, emptyList(), gpa, Gender.OTHER);
071
072    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("is taking 0 classes."));
073  }
074
075  @Test
076  void studentTakingOneClass() {
077    String className = "Class1";
078    List<String> classes = List.of(className);
079
080    Student student = new Student("Name", classes, 3.45, Gender.OTHER);
081
082    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("is taking 1 class: " + className + "."));
083
084  }
085
086  @Test
087  void studentTakingTwoClasses() {
088    String className1 = "Class1";
089    String className2 = "Class2";
090    List<String> classes = List.of(className1, className2);
091
092    Student student = new Student("Name", classes, 3.45, Gender.OTHER);
093
094    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("is taking 2 classes: " + className1 + " and " + className2 + "."));
095
096  }
097
098  @Test
099  void studentTakingThreeClasses() {
100    String className1 = "Class1";
101    String className2 = "Class2";
102    String className3 = "Class3";
103    List<String> classes = List.of(className1, className2, className3);
104
105    Student student = new Student("Name", classes, 3.45, Gender.OTHER);
106
107    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("is taking 3 classes: " + className1 + ", " + className2 + ", and " + className3 + "."));
108
109  }
110
111  @Test
112  void studentTakingFourClasses() {
113    String className1 = "Class1";
114    String className2 = "Class2";
115    String className3 = "Class3";
116    String className4 = "Class4";
117    List<String> classes = List.of(className1, className2, className3, className4);
118
119    Student student = new Student("Name", classes, 3.45, Gender.OTHER);
120
121    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("is taking 4 classes: " + className1 + ", " + className2 + ", " + className3 + ", and " + className4 + "."));
122
123  }
124
125  @Test
126  void toStringContainsGenderPronoun() {
127    Student student = new Student("Name", emptyList(), 3.45, Gender.OTHER);
128    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("They"));
129  }
130
131  @Test
132  void toStringContainsFemaleGenderPronoun() {
133    Student student = new Student("Name", emptyList(), 3.45, Gender.FEMALE);
134    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("She"));
135  }
136
137  @Test
138  void toStringContainsMaleGenderPronoun() {
139    Student student = new Student("Name", emptyList(), 3.45, Gender.MALE);
140    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString("He"));
141  }
142
143  @Test
144  void allStudentsSayThisClassIsTooMuchWork() {
145    Student student = new Student("Name", emptyList(), 3.45, Gender.MALE);
146    assertThat(student.says(), equalTo("This class is too much work"));
147  }
148
149  @Test
150  void toStringContainsWhatStudentSays() {
151    Student student = new Student("Name", emptyList(), 3.45, Gender.MALE);
152    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(" says \"This class is too much work\"."));
153  }
154
155
156}
